meaning: child, sign of the rat, 11PM-1AM, first sign of Chinese zodiac

onyomiExamples.meaning: child (esp. a boy), viscount, founder of a school of thought (esp. Confucius), master, masters and philosophers (categorization of Chinese classical literature), you, -er (i.e. man who spends all his time doing...)
honorific (or familiar) suffix used after a name
Ebisu, god of fishing and commerce
seven pairs, winning hand composed of seven pairs

kunyomiExamples.meaning: child, young (animal), young woman, young geisha, offshoot, interest, new shares, player who is not a dealer (in cards, mahjong, etc.), bird egg, -er (often of young women)
root (of a plant), stump (of a tree), root (of a problem, etc.), base, foundation, origin, source
true Tokyoite, Edoite, person born and raised in Edo
the Rat (first sign of the Chinese zodiac), hour of the Rat (around midnight, 11pm to 1am, or 12 midnight to 2am), north, eleventh month of the lunar calendar
collecting herbs and pulling out young pine trees by the roots (annual event held on the first day of the Rat of the New Year)
Metal Rat (37th year of the sexagenary cycle, e.g. 1960, 2020, 2080)
Wood Rat (1st year of the sexagenary cycle, e.g. 1924, 1984, 2044)
